algorithm_technique: Three-way partitioning using two pointers to maintain relative order
problem_summary_simple: Rearrange an array so elements less than pivot are first, then equal, then greater, maintaining relative order.
problem_summary_technical: Uses two pointers to place elements less than pivot at the beginning and greater than pivot at the end, preserving relative order.
key_insights: The requirement to maintain relative order for elements less than and greater than the pivot is key.
A single pass with two pointers (one for the start of 'less than' section, one for the end of 'greater than' section) is efficient.
A temporary result array is used to build the partitioned array without in-place swaps that would disrupt relative order.
